title: Anne Frank: The Exhibition
description: A full-scale recreation of the rooms where Anne Frank and others spent two years hiding to evade Nazi capture.

title: Neko Case and Samantha Bee in Conversation
description: Beloved musician Neko Case launches her memoir, sharing intimate tales of resilience in a conversation with Samantha Bee.

title: Lady Journey Comedy
description: Hosts Katie Hannigan and Sarah Tollemache bring some of their favorite comics to Grove 34 for a night of standup.

title: Movie Musical Mondays
description: A monthly series of iconic musicals hits the big screen at Village East by Angelika, continuing with Grease (1978).

title: Dirty Little Secrets Improv Show
description: Your anonymously-submitted confessions serve as inspiration for improv performers.

title: New York Road Runners Fred Lebow Half-Marathon
description: The annual 13.1-mile run winds its way around Central Park's Ted Corbitt loop.

title: International Holocaust Remembrance Day Concert
description: Commemorates International Holocaust Remembrance Day with a chamber music concert featuring a string sextet from the Manhattan Chamber Players.
address: Museum of Jewish Heritage – A Living Memorial to the Holocaust, Battery Park

title: Washington Heights Chamber Orchestra: ‘Echos’
description: Washington Heights Chamber Orchestra continues the season with a program including works by composers past and present.
address: Fort Washington Collegiate Church, Washington Heights

title: Comics Reading Comics
description: Live show that combines stand-up comedy and superhero storytelling, focusing on Marvel's disco-themed hero, Dazzler.

title: World’s Greatest Gamer
description: E-sports competition where every round is a different game, hosted by Noah Waterman.
address: Footlight Underground at the Windjammer, Ridgewood

title: 27th Annual Postcards from the Edge
description: Visual Aids’s signature benefit event returns to Berry Campbell Gallery in Tribeca with over 1,500 postcard-sized artworks created anonymously by both established and emerging artists. Each piece is priced at $100, and the identity of each artwork’s creator will be revealed only after purchase. Sales open online Saturday at 10am. Preview party Friday ($100 admission), exhibition Saturday + Sunday 12-5pm (free admission).
cost: $100 admission for preview party, free admission for exhibition

title: Eli Yudin Comedy Special Taping
description: Comedian Eli Yudin tapes a stand-up special at The Gutter in Greenpoint.
cost: $5-10 (all proceeds will be donated to LA wildfire relief)

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: A women-produced and-hosted comedy show featuring stand-up by Vannessa Jackson, Carson Olshanksky, Brey Raybould, Igor Martinez, and Michael Schirtzer.
cost: Free admission (a tip jar will be passed around at the end of the show)

title: The Drunk Texts: The Merry Busters of Ghosts
description: Catch a Shakespearean adaptation of a movie classic paired with drinking games and audience participation at Random Access Theatre’s ‘The Drunk Texts’ series.

title: Drunk Planet Earth
description: Participatory show where the audience watches Animal Planet III, drinks, and tries to stump the hosts with animal trivia.

title: Meet the Breeds
description: Encounter pups from affenpinschers to yorkshire terriers and everything in between at the American Kennel Club’s annual Meet the Breeds event, featuring over 130 different dog breeds to meet, play with, and learn about.
address: Jacob K. Javits Convention Center, Hell’s Kitchen
cost: $30 general with promo code ‘bellyrubs’ (reg. $35), $20 seniors/students, $10 kiddos

title: New York Travel + Adventure Show
description: Explore the world under one roof at the annual New York Travel + Adventure Show, where exhibitors showcase destinations, tour operators, cruise lines, hotels, and more.
address: Jacob K. Javits Center, Hell’s Kitchen

title: To Live and Rebuild in LA: A Bake Sale
description: Cookies (and more) for a cause. Archestratus Books + Foods is hosting a pair of bake sales to benefit Los Angeles fire relief organizations.

title: Graffiti Black Book/Scrapbook: 1978 + Beyond with Zephyr
description: Graffiti artist and author Zephyr presents his latest book, a visual collection of life in New York City from the late 70s to the early 80s as experienced by a graffiti pioneer.
address: Museum of the City of New York, East Harlem
cost: $15 admission (books will be available for purchase)

title: Pataphysics Audiovisual Concert Series
description: Multi-sensory scene at the latest installment of Delight Factory’s bi-monthly Pataphysics Audiovisual Concert Series, pairing experimental music and visuals.

title: The Fantasy Tavern: Heroes + Villains Edition
description: An interactive show and party featuring a cast of colorful characters performing drinking songs celebrating all things nerd culture.

title: Improvised Dungeons and Dragons
description: An improvised D&D comedy adventure where the audience creates the heroes, casts the spells, and rolls the die.
address: Under St. Marks Theater, East Village

title: Corpse Flower at Brooklyn Botanic Garden
description: A giant corpse flower (amorphophallus titanum) is poised to bloom any day now, releasing an aroma that’s been likened to rotting flesh. The phenomenon normally lasts only about 24-36 hours, so check the venue’s social media for updates.
cost: Included with regular admission (pay-what-you-wish winter weekdays, $22 general/$16 seniors + students weekends)

title: The 71st Winter Show
description: Discover a dazzling array of paintings, fine furniture, works on paper, ceramics, glass, jewelry, and rare books from 70 exhibitors at the winter show, an annual art, antiques, and design fair. Your ticket includes access to panel discussions, and proceeds from admission will benefit East Side House Settlement.

title: David Lynch Screenings
description: IFC Center, Look Cinemas, and Village East by Angelika pay tribute to filmmaker David Lynch with screenings through next week.
address: IFC Center, Look Cinemas, Village East by Angelika
